abstract: A jury decided not to impose punitive damages against Wells Fargo on Thursday, a day after those jurors awarded $29.9 million to four nonprofits after finding the bank had breached its fiduciary duty and engaged in fraud.

lead_paragraph: A jury decided not to impose punitive damages against Wells Fargo on Thursday, a day after those jurors awarded $29.9 million to four nonprofits after finding the bank had breached its fiduciary duty and engaged in fraud.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Jury Decides Against Punitive Damages
